meanings.definition: Able to be seen or noticed.
meanings.sent1: The bright stars in the night sky are observables.
meanings.sent2: The colorful flowers in the garden are observables.
meanings.sent3: The observables in the magic show amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an observable trait that everyone admired.
meanings.sent5: The observables in the painting captured the artist's attention.

meanings.definition: Things that can be observed or perceived.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use various tools to study observables in nature.
meanings.sent2: The observables in the experiment provided valuable data.
meanings.sent3: The detective carefully examined the observables at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The observables in the distance seemed to shimmer in the heat.
meanings.sent5: Children were excited to explore the observables at the science museum.
